newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan Jun-Aug temperature seen low to average.
newsitem.headline: Japan Jun-Aug temperature seen low to average.

text.p: Average temperatures in eastern and western Japan are expected to be a little lower than usual during the June-August period, the Meteorological Agency said in its latest three-month weather report released on Tuesday.
It said temperatures were likely to be a little higher than usual in northern Japan and in the southwestern islands.
Rainfall during the season is expected to be heavy in eastern and western Japan, and about average in northern Japan as well as the southwestern islands.
June is expected to see many cloudy and rainy days, the agency said.
It said temperatures and rainfall in June were likely to be about the same as the average year.
The agency forecast more cloudy and rainy days than the average year for July. Temperatures are expected to be low during the month.
The exception is expected to be the southwestern islands which are likely to see sunny days and average temperatures.
Rainfall in July is expected to be heavy in eastern and western Japan, and about average in northern Japan and the southwestern islands.
The days are expected to be sunny for most of August with some sporadically bad weather. Temperatures and rainfall are expected to be about average, the agency said.
